Definition: ALS
Amyotrophic lateral sclerosis
(ALS), also called Lou Gehrig’s disease, is a neuromuscular disease that causes degeneration of nerve cells in the brain and spinal cord, resulting in muscle weakness, muscle atrophy, and spontaneous muscle activity.
title: M21-1, Part V, Subpart iii, Chapter 12, Section C - Progressive Neurological Disorders
